New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder won their 11th straight game
Key Match Events: Oklahoma City outscored the Grizzlies 42-19 in the second quarter
Oklahoma City went on a 32-9 run to extend the lead to 74-45
Oklahoma City converted 21 Memphis turnovers into 33 points
Post-Match Reflections: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander made 14 of 19 shots to go along with seven assists, six rebounds and a team-high four blocks
Miscellaneous Highlights: Memphis played without star Ja Morant (shoulder) and Zach Edey, the teamâ€™s No. 9 overall draft pick, who was in concussion protocol
Oklahoma City lost the rebound battle 51-46, but outscored the Grizzlies 56-36 in the paint
Others: Memphis pulled within 42-36 on a jumper by Jackson, but Oklahoma City went on a 32-9 run to extend the lead to 74-45 and put the game out of reach before halftime
